revised_title: Observations of the Earthquake Near Oxford and its Consequences
tldr: In this article, Mr. Boyle shares his observations and experiences of the Earthquake near Oxford. He describes the sudden changes in the weather and atmosphere, including a shift from frosty weather to a cold, piercing wind and rain. He also mentions the tremors he felt in his house and the reports from others about the extent of the earthquake. This account provides insights into the understanding of natural phenomena and weather changes during that time.
